metadata.title: CVE-2024-45028 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:mmc: mmc_test: Fix NULL dereference on allocation failureIf the "test->highmem = alloc_pages()" allocation fails then calling__free_pages(test->highmem) will result in a NULL dereference.  Alsochange the error code to -ENOMEM instead of returning success.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-45028` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-200-generic - 5.4.0-200.220~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-200-lowlatency - 5.4.0-200.220~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1135-aws - 5.4.0-1135.145~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1140-azure - 5.4.0-1140.147~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1139-gcp - 5.4.0-1139.148~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1082-ibm - 5.4.0-1082.87~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1134-oracle - 5.4.0-1134.143~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-1119-raspi - 5.4.0-1119.131~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-200.220~18.04.1').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.3').
